text_entry: O wonderful son, that can so astonish a mother! But

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: is there no sequel at the heels of this mother\'s

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: admiration? Impart.

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: She desires to speak with you in her closet, ere you

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: go to bed.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: We shall obey, were she ten times our mother. Have

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: you any further trade with us?

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: My lord, you once did love me.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: So I do still, by these pickers and stealers.

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: Good my lord, what is your cause of distemper? you

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: do, surely, bar the door upon your own liberty, if

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: you deny your griefs to your friend.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Sir, I lack advancement.

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: How can that be, when you have the voice of the king

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: himself for your succession in Denmark?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Ay, but sir, \'While the grass grows,\'--the proverb

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: is something musty.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Re-enter Players with recorders

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: O, the recorders! let me see one. To withdraw with

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: you:--why do you go about to recover the wind of me,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: as if you would drive me into a toil?

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: O, my lord, if my duty be too bold, my love is too

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: unmannerly.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I do not well understand that. Will you play upon

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: this pipe?

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: My lord, I cannot.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I pray you.

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: Believe me, I cannot.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I do beseech you.

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: I know no touch of it, my lord.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: \'Tis as easy as lying: govern these ventages with

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: your lingers and thumb, give it breath with your

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: mouth, and it will discourse most eloquent music.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Look you, these are the stops.

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: But these cannot I command to any utterance of

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: harmony; I have not the skill.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Why, look you now, how unworthy a thing you make of

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: me! You would play upon me; you would seem to know

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: my stops; you would pluck out the heart of my

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: mystery; you would sound me from my lowest note to

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: the top of my compass: and there is much music,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: excellent voice, in this little organ; yet cannot

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: you make it speak. \'Sblood, do you think I am

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: easier to be played on than a pipe? Call me what

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: instrument you will, though you can fret me, yet you

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: cannot play upon me.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Enter POLONIUS

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: God bless you, sir!

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: My lord, the queen would speak with you, and

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: presently.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Do you see yonder cloud that\'s almost in shape of a camel?

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: By the mass, and \'tis like a camel, indeed.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Methinks it is like a weasel.

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: It is backed like a weasel.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Or like a whale?

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: Very like a whale.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Then I will come to my mother by and by. They fool

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: me to the top of my bent. I will come by and by.

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: I will say so.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: By and by is easily said.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Exit POLONIUS

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Leave me, friends.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Exeunt all but HAMLET

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Tis now the very witching time of night,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: When churchyards yawn and hell itself breathes out

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Contagion to this world: now could I drink hot blood,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And do such bitter business as the day

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Would quake to look on. Soft! now to my mother.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: O heart, lose not thy nature; let not ever

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: The soul of Nero enter this firm bosom:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Let me be cruel, not unnatural:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I will speak daggers to her, but use none;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: My tongue and soul in this be hypocrites;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: How in my words soever she be shent,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: To give them seals never, my soul, consent!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Exit

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: SCENE III. A room in the castle.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Enter KING CLAUDIUS, ROSENCRANTZ, and GUILDENSTERN

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: I like him not, nor stands it safe with us

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: To let his madness range. Therefore prepare you;

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: I your commission will forthwith dispatch,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And he to England shall along with you:

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: The terms of our estate may not endure

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Hazard so dangerous as doth hourly grow

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Out of his lunacies.

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: We will ourselves provide:

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: Most holy and religious fear it is

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: To keep those many many bodies safe

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: That live and feed upon your majesty.

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: The single and peculiar life is bound,

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: With all the strength and armour of the mind,

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: To keep itself from noyance; but much more

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: That spirit upon whose weal depend and rest

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: The lives of many. The cease of majesty

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: Dies not alone; but, like a gulf, doth draw

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: What\'s near it with it: it is a massy wheel,

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: Fix\'d on the summit of the highest mount,

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: To whose huge spokes ten thousand lesser things

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: Are mortised and adjoin\'d; which, when it falls,

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: Each small annexment, petty consequence,

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: Attends the boisterous ruin. Never alone

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: Did the king sigh, but with a general groan.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Arm you, I pray you, to this speedy voyage;

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: For we will fetters put upon this fear,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Which now goes too free-footed.

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: We will haste us.

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: Exeunt ROSENCRANTZ and GUILDENSTERN

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: Enter POLONIUS

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: My lord, he\'s going to his mother\'s closet:

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: Behind the arras I\'ll convey myself,

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: To hear the process; and warrant she\'ll tax him home:

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: And, as you said, and wisely was it said,

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: \'Tis meet that some more audience than a mother,

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: Since nature makes them partial, should o\'erhear

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: The speech, of vantage. Fare you well, my liege:

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: I\'ll call upon you ere you go to bed,

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: And tell you what I know.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Thanks, dear my lord.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Exit POLONIUS

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: O, my offence is rank it smells to heaven;

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: It hath the primal eldest curse upon\'t,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: A brother\'s murder. Pray can I not,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Though inclination be as sharp as will:

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: My stronger guilt defeats my strong intent;

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And, like a man to double business bound,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: I stand in pause where I shall first begin,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And both neglect. What if this cursed hand

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Were thicker than itself with brother\'s blood,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Is there not rain enough in the sweet heavens

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: To wash it white as snow? Whereto serves mercy

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: But to confront the visage of offence?

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And what\'s in prayer but this two-fold force,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: To be forestalled ere we come to fall,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Or pardon\'d being down? Then I\'ll look up;

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: My fault is past. But, O, what form of prayer

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Can serve my turn? \'Forgive me my foul murder\'?

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: That cannot be; since I am still possess\'d

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Of those effects for which I did the murder,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: My crown, mine own ambition and my queen.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: May one be pardon\'d and retain the offence?

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: In the corrupted currents of this world

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Offence\'s gilded hand may shove by justice,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And oft \'tis seen the wicked prize itself

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Buys out the law: but \'tis not so above;

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: There is no shuffling, there the action lies

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: In his true nature; and we ourselves compell\'d,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Even to the teeth and forehead of our faults,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: To give in evidence. What then? what rests?

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Try what repentance can: what can it not?

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Yet what can it when one can not repent?

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: O wretched state! O bosom black as death!

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: O limed soul, that, struggling to be free,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Art more engaged! Help, angels! Make assay!

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Bow, stubborn knees; and, heart with strings of steel,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Be soft as sinews of the newborn babe!

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: All may be well.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Retires and kneels

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Enter HAMLET

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Now might I do it pat, now he is praying;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And now I\'ll do\'t. And so he goes to heaven;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And so am I revenged. That would be scann\'d:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: A villain kills my father; and for that,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I, his sole son, do this same villain send

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: To heaven.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: O, this is hire and salary, not revenge.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: He took my father grossly, full of bread;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: With all his crimes broad blown, as flush as May;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And how his audit stands who knows save heaven?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: But in our circumstance and course of thought,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: \'Tis heavy with him: and am I then revenged,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: To take him in the purging of his soul,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: When he is fit and season\'d for his passage?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: No!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Up, sword; and know thou a more horrid hent:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: When he is drunk asleep, or in his rage,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Or in the incestuous pleasure of his bed;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: At gaming, swearing, or about some act

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That has no relish of salvation in\'t;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Then trip him, that his heels may kick at heaven,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And that his soul may be as damn\'d and black

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: As hell, whereto it goes. My mother stays:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: This physic but prolongs thy sickly days.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Exit

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: [Rising]  My words fly up, my thoughts remain below:

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Words without thoughts never to heaven go.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Exit

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: SCENE IV. The Queen\'s closet.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Enter QUEEN GERTRUDE and POLONIUS

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: He will come straight. Look you lay home to him:

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: Tell him his pranks have been too broad to bear with,

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: And that your grace hath screen\'d and stood between

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: Much heat and him. I\'ll sconce me even here.

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: Pray you, be round with him.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: [Within]  Mother, mother, mother!

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: I\'ll warrant you,

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Fear me not: withdraw, I hear him coming.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: POLONIUS hides behind the arras

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Enter HAMLET

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Now, mother, what\'s the matter?

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Hamlet, thou hast thy father much offended.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Mother, you have my father much offended.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Come, come, you answer with an idle tongue.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Go, go, you question with a wicked tongue.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Why, how now, Hamlet!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: What\'s the matter now?

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Have you forgot me?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: No, by the rood, not so:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: You are the queen, your husband\'s brother\'s wife;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And--would it were not so!--you are my mother.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Nay, then, I\'ll set those to you that can speak.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Come, come, and sit you down; you shall not budge;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: You go not till I set you up a glass

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Where you may see the inmost part of you.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: What wilt thou do? thou wilt not murder me?

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Help, help, ho!

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: [Behind]  What, ho! help, help, help!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: [Drawing]  How now! a rat? Dead, for a ducat, dead!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Makes a pass through the arras

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: [Behind]  O, I am slain!

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: Falls and dies

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: O me, what hast thou done?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Nay, I know not:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Is it the king?

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: O, what a rash and bloody deed is this!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: A bloody deed! almost as bad, good mother,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: As kill a king, and marry with his brother.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: As kill a king!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Ay, lady, \'twas my word.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Lifts up the array and discovers POLONIUS

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Thou wretched, rash, intruding fool, farewell!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I took thee for thy better: take thy fortune;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Thou find\'st to be too busy is some danger.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Leave wringing of your hands: peace! sit you down,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And let me wring your heart; for so I shall,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: If it be made of penetrable stuff,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: If damned custom have not brass\'d it so

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That it is proof and bulwark against sense.

text_entry: What have I done, that thou darest wag thy tongue

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: In noise so rude against me?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Such an act

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That blurs the grace and blush of modesty,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: From the fair forehead of an innocent love

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And sets a blister there, makes marriage-vows

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: As false as dicers\' oaths: O, such a deed

text_entry: As from the body of contraction plucks

text_entry: The very soul, and sweet religion makes

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Yea, this solidity and compound mass,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: With tristful visage, as against the doom,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Is thought-sick at the act.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Ay me, what act,

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: That roars so loud, and thunders in the index?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Look here, upon this picture, and on this,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: The counterfeit presentment of two brothers.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: See, what a grace was seated on this brow;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Hyperion\'s curls; the front of Jove himself;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: An eye like Mars, to threaten and command;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: A station like the herald Mercury

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: New-lighted on a heaven-kissing hill;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: A combination and a form indeed,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Where every god did seem to set his seal,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: To give the world assurance of a man:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: This was your husband. Look you now, what follows:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Here is your husband; like a mildew\'d ear,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Blasting his wholesome brother. Have you eyes?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Could you on this fair mountain leave to feed,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And batten on this moor? Ha! have you eyes?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: You cannot call it love; for at your age

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: The hey-day in the blood is tame, it\'s humble,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And waits upon the judgment: and what judgment

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Would step from this to this? Sense, sure, you have,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Else could you not have motion; but sure, that sense

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Is apoplex\'d; for madness would not err,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Nor sense to ecstasy was ne\'er so thrall\'d

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: But it reserved some quantity of choice,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: To serve in such a difference. What devil was\'t

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That thus hath cozen\'d you at hoodman-blind?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Eyes without feeling, feeling without sight,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Ears without hands or eyes, smelling sans all,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Or but a sickly part of one true sense

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Could not so mope.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: O shame! where is thy blush? Rebellious hell,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: If thou canst mutine in a matron\'s bones,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: To flaming youth let virtue be as wax,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And melt in her own fire: proclaim no shame

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: When the compulsive ardour gives the charge,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Since frost itself as actively doth burn

speaker: HAMLET

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: O Hamlet, speak no more:

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Thou turn\'st mine eyes into my very soul;

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: And there I see such black and grained spots

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: As will not leave their tinct.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Nay, but to live

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: In the rank sweat of an enseamed bed,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Stew\'d in corruption, honeying and making love

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Over the nasty sty,--

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: O, speak to me no more;

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: These words, like daggers, enter in mine ears;

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: No more, sweet Hamlet!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: A murderer and a villain;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: A slave that is not twentieth part the tithe

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Of your precedent lord; a vice of kings;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: A cutpurse of the empire and the rule,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That from a shelf the precious diadem stole,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And put it in his pocket!

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: No more!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: A king of shreds and patches,--

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Enter Ghost

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Save me, and hover o\'er me with your wings,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: You heavenly guards! What would your gracious figure?

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Alas, he\'s mad!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Do you not come your tardy son to chide,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That, lapsed in time and passion, lets go by

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: The important acting of your dread command? O, say!

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: Do not forget: this visitation

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: Is but to whet thy almost blunted purpose.

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: But, look, amazement on thy mother sits:

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: O, step between her and her fighting soul:

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: Conceit in weakest bodies strongest works:

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: Speak to her, Hamlet.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: How is it with you, lady?

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Alas, how is\'t with you,

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: That you do bend your eye on vacancy

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: And with the incorporal air do hold discourse?

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Forth at your eyes your spirits wildly peep;

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: And, as the sleeping soldiers in the alarm,

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Your bedded hair, like life in excrements,

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Starts up, and stands on end. O gentle son,

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Upon the heat and flame of thy distemper

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Sprinkle cool patience. Whereon do you look?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: On him, on him! Look you, how pale he glares!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: His form and cause conjoin\'d, preaching to stones,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Would make them capable. Do not look upon me;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Lest with this piteous action you convert

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: My stern effects: then what I have to do

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Will want true colour; tears perchance for blood.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: To whom do you speak this?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Do you see nothing there?

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Nothing at all; yet all that is I see.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Nor did you nothing hear?

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: No, nothing but ourselves.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Why, look you there! look, how it steals away!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: My father, in his habit as he lived!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Look, where he goes, even now, out at the portal!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Exit Ghost

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: This the very coinage of your brain:

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: This bodiless creation ecstasy

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Is very cunning in.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Ecstasy!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: My pulse, as yours, doth temperately keep time,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And makes as healthful music: it is not madness

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That I have utter\'d: bring me to the test,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And I the matter will re-word; which madness

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Would gambol from. Mother, for love of grace,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Lay not that mattering unction to your soul,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That not your trespass, but my madness speaks:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: It will but skin and film the ulcerous place,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Whilst rank corruption, mining all within,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Infects unseen. Confess yourself to heaven;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Repent what\'s past; avoid what is to come;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And do not spread the compost on the weeds,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: To make them ranker. Forgive me this my virtue;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: For in the fatness of these pursy times

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Virtue itself of vice must pardon beg,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Yea, curb and woo for leave to do him good.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: O Hamlet, thou hast cleft my heart in twain.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: O, throw away the worser part of it,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And live the purer with the other half.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Good night: but go not to mine uncle\'s bed;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Assume a virtue, if you have it not.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That monster, custom, who all sense doth eat,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Of habits devil, is angel yet in this,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That to the use of actions fair and good

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: He likewise gives a frock or livery,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That aptly is put on. Refrain to-night,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And that shall lend a kind of easiness

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: To the next abstinence: the next more easy;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: For use almost can change the stamp of nature,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And either [         ] the devil, or throw him out

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: With wondrous potency. Once more, good night:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And when you are desirous to be bless\'d,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I\'ll blessing beg of you. For this same lord,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Pointing to POLONIUS

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I do repent: but heaven hath pleased it so,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: To punish me with this and this with me,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That I must be their scourge and minister.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I will bestow him, and will answer well

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: The death I gave him. So, again, good night.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I must be cruel, only to be kind:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Thus bad begins and worse remains behind.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: One word more, good lady.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: What shall I do?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Not this, by no means, that I bid you do:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Let the bloat king tempt you again to bed;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Pinch wanton on your cheek; call you his mouse;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And let him, for a pair of reechy kisses,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Or paddling in your neck with his damn\'d fingers,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Make you to ravel all this matter out,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That I essentially am not in madness,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: But mad in craft. \'Twere good you let him know;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: For who, that\'s but a queen, fair, sober, wise,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Would from a paddock, from a bat, a gib,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Such dear concernings hide? who would do so?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: No, in despite of sense and secrecy,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Unpeg the basket on the house\'s top.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Let the birds fly, and, like the famous ape,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: To try conclusions, in the basket creep,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And break your own neck down.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Be thou assured, if words be made of breath,

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: And breath of life, I have no life to breathe

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: What thou hast said to me.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I must to England; you know that?

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Alack,

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: I had forgot: \'tis so concluded on.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: There\'s letters seal\'d: and my two schoolfellows,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Whom I will trust as I will adders fang\'d,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: They bear the mandate; they must sweep my way,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And marshal me to knavery. Let it work;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: For \'tis the sport to have the engineer

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Hoist with his own petard: and \'t shall go hard

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: But I will delve one yard below their mines,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And blow them at the moon: O, \'tis most sweet,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: When in one line two crafts directly meet.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: This man shall set me packing:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I\'ll lug the guts into the neighbour room.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Mother, good night. Indeed this counsellor

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Is now most still, most secret and most grave,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Who was in life a foolish prating knave.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Come, sir, to draw toward an end with you.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Good night, mother.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Exeunt severally; HAMLET dragging in POLONIUS

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: ACT IV

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: SCENE I. A room in the castle.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Enter KING CLAUDIUS, QUEEN GERTRUDE, ROSENCRANTZ, and GUILDENSTERN

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: There\'s matter in these sighs, these profound heaves:

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: You must translate: \'tis fit we understand them.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Where is your son?

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Bestow this place on us a little while.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Exeunt ROSENCRANTZ and GUILDENSTERN

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Ah, my good lord, what have I seen to-night!

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: What, Gertrude? How does Hamlet?

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Mad as the sea and wind, when both contend

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Which is the mightier: in his lawless fit,

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Behind the arras hearing something stir,

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Whips out his rapier, cries, \'A rat, a rat!\'

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: And, in this brainish apprehension, kills

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: The unseen good old man.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: O heavy deed!

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: It had been so with us, had we been there:

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: His liberty is full of threats to all;

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: To you yourself, to us, to every one.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Alas, how shall this bloody deed be answer\'d?

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: It will be laid to us, whose providence

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Should have kept short, restrain\'d and out of haunt,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: This mad young man: but so much was our love,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: We would not understand what was most fit;

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: But, like the owner of a foul disease,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: To keep it from divulging, let it feed

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Even on the pith of Life. Where is he gone?

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: To draw apart the body he hath kill\'d:

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: O\'er whom his very madness, like some ore

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Among a mineral of metals base,

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Shows itself pure; he weeps for what is done.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: O Gertrude, come away!

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: The sun no sooner shall the mountains touch,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: But we will ship him hence: and this vile deed

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: We must, with all our majesty and skill,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Both countenance and excuse. Ho, Guildenstern!

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Re-enter ROSENCRANTZ and GUILDENSTERN

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Friends both, go join you with some further aid:

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Hamlet in madness hath Polonius slain,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And from his mother\'s closet hath he dragg\'d him:

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Go seek him out; speak fair, and bring the body

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Into the chapel. I pray you, haste in this.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Exeunt ROSENCRANTZ and GUILDENSTERN

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Come, Gertrude, we\'ll call up our wisest friends;

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And let them know, both what we mean to do,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And what\'s untimely done. O, come away!

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: My soul is full of discord and dismay.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: SCENE II. Another room in the castle.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Enter HAMLET

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Safely stowed.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: ROSENCRANTZ:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: GUILDENSTERN:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: [Within]  Hamlet! Lord Hamlet!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: What noise? who calls on Hamlet?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: O, here they come.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Enter ROSENCRANTZ and GUILDENSTERN

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: What have you done, my lord, with the dead body?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Compounded it with dust, whereto \'tis kin.

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: Tell us where \'tis, that we may take it thence

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: And bear it to the chapel.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Do not believe it.

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: Believe what?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That I can keep your counsel and not mine own.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Besides, to be demanded of a sponge! what

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: replication should be made by the son of a king?

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: Take you me for a sponge, my lord?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Ay, sir, that soaks up the king\'s countenance, his

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: rewards, his authorities. But such officers do the

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: king best service in the end: he keeps them, like

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: an ape, in the corner of his jaw; first mouthed, to

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: be last swallowed: when he needs what you have

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: gleaned, it is but squeezing you, and, sponge, you

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: shall be dry again.

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: I understand you not, my lord.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I am glad of it: a knavish speech sleeps in a

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: foolish ear.

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: My lord, you must tell us where the body is, and go

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: with us to the king.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: The body is with the king, but the king is not with

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: the body. The king is a thing--

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: A thing, my lord!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Of nothing: bring me to him. Hide fox, and all after.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: SCENE III. Another room in the castle.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Enter KING CLAUDIUS, attended

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: I have sent to seek him, and to find the body.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: How dangerous is it that this man goes loose!

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Yet must not we put the strong law on him:

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: He\'s loved of the distracted multitude,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Who like not in their judgment, but their eyes;

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And where tis so, the offender\'s scourge is weigh\'d,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: But never the offence. To bear all smooth and even,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: This sudden sending him away must seem

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Deliberate pause: diseases desperate grown

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: By desperate appliance are relieved,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Or not at all.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Enter ROSENCRANTZ

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: How now! what hath befall\'n?

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: Where the dead body is bestow\'d, my lord,

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: We cannot get from him.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: But where is he?

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: Without, my lord; guarded, to know your pleasure.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Bring him before us.

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: Ho, Guildenstern! bring in my lord.

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: Enter HAMLET and GUILDENSTERN

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Now, Hamlet, where\'s Polonius?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: At supper.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: At supper! where?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Not where he eats, but where he is eaten: a certain

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: convocation of politic worms are e\'en at him. Your

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: worm is your only emperor for diet: we fat all

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: creatures else to fat us, and we fat ourselves for

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: maggots: your fat king and your lean beggar is but

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: variable service, two dishes, but to one table:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: that\'s the end.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Alas, alas!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: A man may fish with the worm that hath eat of a

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: king, and cat of the fish that hath fed of that worm.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: What dost you mean by this?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Nothing but to show you how a king may go a

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: progress through the guts of a beggar.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Where is Polonius?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: In heaven; send hither to see: if your messenger

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: find him not there, seek him i\' the other place

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: yourself. But indeed, if you find him not within

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: this month, you shall nose him as you go up the

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: stairs into the lobby.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Go seek him there.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: To some Attendants

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: He will stay till ye come.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Exeunt Attendants

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Hamlet, this deed, for thine especial safety,--

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Which we do tender, as we dearly grieve

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: For that which thou hast done,--must send thee hence

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: With fiery quickness: therefore prepare thyself;

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: The bark is ready, and the wind at help,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: The associates tend, and every thing is bent

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: For England.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: For England!

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Ay, Hamlet.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Good.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: So is it, if thou knew\'st our purposes.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I see a cherub that sees them. But, come; for

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: England! Farewell, dear mother.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Thy loving father, Hamlet.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: My mother: father and mother is man and wife; man

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: and wife is one flesh; and so, my mother. Come, for England!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Exit

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Follow him at foot; tempt him with speed aboard;

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Delay it not; I\'ll have him hence to-night:

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Away! for every thing is seal\'d and done

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: That else leans on the affair: pray you, make haste.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Exeunt ROSENCRANTZ and GUILDENSTERN

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And, England, if my love thou hold\'st at aught--

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: As my great power thereof may give thee sense,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Since yet thy cicatrice looks raw and red

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: After the Danish sword, and thy free awe

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Pays homage to us--thou mayst not coldly set

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Our sovereign process; which imports at full,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: By letters congruing to that effect,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: The present death of Hamlet. Do it, England;

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: For like the hectic in my blood he rages,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And thou must cure me: till I know \'tis done,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Howe\'er my haps, my joys were ne\'er begun.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Exit

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: SCENE IV. A plain in Denmark.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Enter FORTINBRAS, a Captain, and Soldiers, marching

speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text_entry: Go, captain, from me greet the Danish king;

speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text_entry: Tell him that, by his licence, Fortinbras

speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text_entry: Craves the conveyance of a promised march

speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text_entry: Over his kingdom. You know the rendezvous.

speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text_entry: If that his majesty would aught with us,

speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text_entry: We shall express our duty in his eye;

speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text_entry: And let him know so.

speaker: Captain
text_entry: I will do\'t, my lord.

speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text_entry: Go softly on.

speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text_entry: Exeunt FORTINBRAS and Soldiers

speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text_entry: Enter HAMLET, ROSENCRANTZ, GUILDENSTERN, and others

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Good sir, whose powers are these?

speaker: Captain
text_entry: They are of Norway, sir.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: How purposed, sir, I pray you?

speaker: Captain
text_entry: Against some part of Poland.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Who commands them, sir?

speaker: Captain
text_entry: The nephews to old Norway, Fortinbras.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Goes it against the main of Poland, sir,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Or for some frontier?

speaker: Captain
text_entry: Truly to speak, and with no addition,

speaker: Captain
text_entry: We go to gain a little patch of ground

speaker: Captain
text_entry: That hath in it no profit but the name.

speaker: Captain
text_entry: To pay five ducats, five, I would not farm it;

speaker: Captain
text_entry: Nor will it yield to Norway or the Pole

speaker: Captain
text_entry: A ranker rate, should it be sold in fee.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Why, then the Polack never will defend it.

speaker: Captain
text_entry: Yes, it is already garrison\'d.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Two thousand souls and twenty thousand ducats

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Will not debate the question of this straw:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: This is the imposthume of much wealth and peace,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That inward breaks, and shows no cause without

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Why the man dies. I humbly thank you, sir.

speaker: Captain
text_entry: God be wi\' you, sir.

speaker: Captain
text_entry: Exit

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: Wilt please you go, my lord?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I\'ll be with you straight go a little before.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Exeunt all except HAMLET

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: How all occasions do inform against me,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And spur my dull revenge! What is a man,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: If his chief good and market of his time

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Be but to sleep and feed? a beast, no more.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Sure, he that made us with such large discourse,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Looking before and after, gave us not

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That capability and god-like reason

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: To fust in us unused. Now, whether it be

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Bestial oblivion, or some craven scruple

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Of thinking too precisely on the event,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: A thought which, quarter\'d, hath but one part wisdom

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And ever three parts coward, I do not know

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Why yet I live to say \'This thing\'s to do;\'

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Sith I have cause and will and strength and means

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: To do\'t. Examples gross as earth exhort me:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Witness this army of such mass and charge

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Led by a delicate and tender prince,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Whose spirit with divine ambition puff\'d

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Makes mouths at the invisible event,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Exposing what is mortal and unsure

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: To all that fortune, death and danger dare,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Even for an egg-shell. Rightly to be great

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Is not to stir without great argument,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: But greatly to find quarrel in a straw

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: When honour\'s at the stake. How stand I then,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That have a father kill\'d, a mother stain\'d,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Excitements of my reason and my blood,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And let all sleep? while, to my shame, I see

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: The imminent death of twenty thousand men,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That, for a fantasy and trick of fame,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Go to their graves like beds, fight for a plot

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Whereon the numbers cannot try the cause,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Which is not tomb enough and continent

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: To hide the slain? O, from this time forth,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: My thoughts be bloody, or be nothing worth!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Exit

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: SCENE V. Elsinore. A room in the castle.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Enter QUEEN GERTRUDE, HORATIO, and a Gentleman

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: I will not speak with her.

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: She is importunate, indeed distract:

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Her mood will needs be pitied.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: What would she have?

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: She speaks much of her father; says she hears

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: There\'s tricks i\' the world; and hems, and beats her heart;

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Spurns enviously at straws; speaks things in doubt,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: That carry but half sense: her speech is nothing,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Yet the unshaped use of it doth move

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: The hearers to collection; they aim at it,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: And botch the words up fit to their own thoughts;

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Which, as her winks, and nods, and gestures

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: yield them,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Indeed would make one think there might be thought,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Though nothing sure, yet much unhappily.

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: \'Twere good she were spoken with; for she may strew

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Dangerous conjectures in ill-breeding minds.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Let her come in.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Exit HORATIO

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: To my sick soul, as sin\'s true nature is,

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Each toy seems prologue to some great amiss:

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: So full of artless jealousy is guilt,

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: It spills itself in fearing to be spilt.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Re-enter HORATIO, with OPHELIA

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Where is the beauteous majesty of Denmark?

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: How now, Ophelia!

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: [Sings]

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: How should I your true love know

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: From another one?

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: By his cockle hat and staff,

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: And his sandal shoon.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Alas, sweet lady, what imports this song?

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Say you? nay, pray you, mark.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Sings

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: He is dead and gone, lady,

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: He is dead and gone;

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: At his head a grass-green turf,

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: At his heels a stone.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Nay, but, Ophelia,--

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Pray you, mark.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Sings

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: White his shroud as the mountain snow,--

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Enter KING CLAUDIUS

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Alas, look here, my lord.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: [Sings]

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Larded with sweet flowers

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Which bewept to the grave did go

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: With true-love showers.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: How do you, pretty lady?

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Well, God \'ild you! They say the owl was a baker\'s

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: daughter. Lord, we know what we are, but know not

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: what we may be. God be at your table!

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Conceit upon her father.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Pray you, let\'s have no words of this; but when they

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: ask you what it means, say you this:

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Sings

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: To-morrow is Saint Valentine\'s day,

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: All in the morning betime,

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: And I a maid at your window,

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: To be your Valentine.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Then up he rose, and donn\'d his clothes,

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: And dupp\'d the chamber-door;

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Let in the maid, that out a maid

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Never departed more.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Pretty Ophelia!

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Indeed, la, without an oath, I\'ll make an end on\'t:

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Sings

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: By Gis and by Saint Charity,

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Alack, and fie for shame!

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Young men will do\'t, if they come to\'t;

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: By cock, they are to blame.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Quoth she, before you tumbled me,

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: You promised me to wed.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: So would I ha\' done, by yonder sun,

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: An thou hadst not come to my bed.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: How long hath she been thus?

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: I hope all will be well. We must be patient: but I

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: cannot choose but weep, to think they should lay him

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: i\' the cold ground. My brother shall know of it:

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: and so I thank you for your good counsel. Come, my

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: coach! Good night, ladies; good night, sweet ladies;

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: good night, good night.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Exit

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Follow her close; give her good watch,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: I pray you.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Exit HORATIO

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: O, this is the poison of deep grief; it springs

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: All from her father\'s death. O Gertrude, Gertrude,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: When sorrows come, they come not single spies

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: But in battalions. First, her father slain:

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Next, your son gone; and he most violent author

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Of his own just remove: the people muddied,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Thick and unwholesome in their thoughts and whispers,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: For good Polonius\' death; and we have done but greenly,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: In hugger-mugger to inter him: poor Ophelia

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Divided from herself and her fair judgment,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Without the which we are pictures, or mere beasts:

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Last, and as much containing as all these,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Her brother is in secret come from France;

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Feeds on his wonder, keeps himself in clouds,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And wants not buzzers to infect his ear

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: With pestilent speeches of his father\'s death;

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Wherein necessity, of matter beggar\'d,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Will nothing stick our person to arraign

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: In ear and ear. O my dear Gertrude, this,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Like to a murdering-piece, in many places

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Gives me superfluous death.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: A noise within

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Alack, what noise is this?

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Where are my Switzers? Let them guard the door.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Enter another Gentleman

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: What is the matter?

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Save yourself, my lord:

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: The ocean, overpeering of his list,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Eats not the flats with more impetuous haste

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Than young Laertes, in a riotous head,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: O\'erbears your officers. The rabble call him lord;

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: And, as the world were now but to begin,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Antiquity forgot, custom not known,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: The ratifiers and props of every word,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: They cry \'Choose we: Laertes shall be king:\'

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Caps, hands, and tongues, applaud it to the clouds:

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: \'Laertes shall be king, Laertes king!\'

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: How cheerfully on the false trail they cry!

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: O, this is counter, you false Danish dogs!

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: The doors are broke.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Noise within

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Enter LAERTES, armed; Danes following

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Where is this king? Sirs, stand you all without.

speaker: Danes
text_entry: No, let\'s come in.

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: I pray you, give me leave.

speaker: Danes
text_entry: We will, we will.

speaker: Danes
text_entry: They retire without the door

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: I thank you: keep the door. O thou vile king,

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Give me my father!

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Calmly, good Laertes.

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: That drop of blood that\'s calm proclaims me bastard,

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Cries cuckold to my father, brands the harlot

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Even here, between the chaste unsmirched brow

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Of my true mother.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: What is the cause, Laertes,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: That thy rebellion looks so giant-like?

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Let him go, Gertrude; do not fear our person:

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: There\'s such divinity doth hedge a king,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: That treason can but peep to what it would,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Acts little of his will. Tell me, Laertes,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Why thou art thus incensed. Let him go, Gertrude.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Speak, man.

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Where is my father?

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Dead.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: But not by him.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Let him demand his fill.

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: How came he dead? I\'ll not be juggled with:

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: To hell, allegiance! vows, to the blackest devil!

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Conscience and grace, to the profoundest pit!

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: I dare damnation. To this point I stand,

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: That both the worlds I give to negligence,

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Let come what comes; only I\'ll be revenged

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Most thoroughly for my father.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Who shall stay you?

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: My will, not all the world:

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: And for my means, I\'ll husband them so well,

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: They shall go far with little.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Good Laertes,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: If you desire to know the certainty

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Of your dear father\'s death, is\'t writ in your revenge,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: That, swoopstake, you will draw both friend and foe,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Winner and loser?

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: None but his enemies.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Will you know them then?

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: To his good friends thus wide I\'ll ope my arms;

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: And like the kind life-rendering pelican,

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Repast them with my blood.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Why, now you speak

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Like a good child and a true gentleman.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: That I am guiltless of your father\'s death,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And am most sensible in grief for it,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: It shall as level to your judgment pierce

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: As day does to your eye.

speaker: Danes
text_entry: [Within]                Let her come in.

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: How now! what noise is that?

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Re-enter OPHELIA

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: O heat, dry up my brains! tears seven times salt,

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Burn out the sense and virtue of mine eye!

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: By heaven, thy madness shall be paid by weight,

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Till our scale turn the beam. O rose of May!

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Dear maid, kind sister, sweet Ophelia!

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: O heavens! is\'t possible, a young maid\'s wits

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Should be as moral as an old man\'s life?

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Nature is fine in love, and where \'tis fine,

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: It sends some precious instance of itself

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: After the thing it loves.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: [Sings]

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: They bore him barefaced on the bier;

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Hey non nonny, nonny, hey nonny;

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: And in his grave rain\'d many a tear:--

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Fare you well, my dove!

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Hadst thou thy wits, and didst persuade revenge,

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: It could not move thus.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: [Sings]

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: You must sing a-down a-down,

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: An you call him a-down-a.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: O, how the wheel becomes it! It is the false

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: steward, that stole his master\'s daughter.

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: This nothing\'s more than matter.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: There\'s rosemary, that\'s for remembrance; pray,

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: love, remember: and there is pansies. that\'s for thoughts.

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: A document in madness, thoughts and remembrance fitted.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: There\'s fennel for you, and columbines: there\'s rue

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: for you; and here\'s some for me: we may call it

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: herb-grace o\' Sundays: O you must wear your rue with

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: a difference. There\'s a daisy: I would give you

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: some violets, but they withered all when my father

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: died: they say he made a good end,--

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Sings

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: For bonny sweet Robin is all my joy.

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Thought and affliction, passion, hell itself,

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: She turns to favour and to prettiness.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: [Sings]

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: And will he not come again?

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: And will he not come again?

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: No, no, he is dead:

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Go to thy death-bed:

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: He never will come again.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: His beard was as white as snow,

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: All flaxen was his poll:

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: He is gone, he is gone,

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: And we cast away moan:

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: God ha\' mercy on his soul!

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: And of all Christian souls, I pray God. God be wi\' ye.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Exit

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Do you see this, O God?

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Laertes, I must commune with your grief,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Or you deny me right. Go but apart,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Make choice of whom your wisest friends you will.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And they shall hear and judge \'twixt you and me:

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: If by direct or by collateral hand

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: They find us touch\'d, we will our kingdom give,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Our crown, our life, and all that we can ours,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: To you in satisfaction; but if not,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Be you content to lend your patience to us,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And we shall jointly labour with your soul

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: To give it due content.

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Let this be so;

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: His means of death, his obscure funeral--

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: No trophy, sword, nor hatchment o\'er his bones,

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: No noble rite nor formal ostentation--

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Cry to be heard, as \'twere from heaven to earth,

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: That I must call\'t in question.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: So you shall;

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And where the offence is let the great axe fall.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: I pray you, go with me.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: SCENE VI. Another room in the castle.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Enter HORATIO and a Servant

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: What are they that would speak with me?

speaker: Servant
text_entry: Sailors, sir: they say they have letters for you.

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Let them come in.

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Exit Servant

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: I do not know from what part of the world

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: I should be greeted, if not from Lord Hamlet.

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Enter Sailors

speaker: First Sailor
text_entry: God bless you, sir.

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Let him bless thee too.

speaker: First Sailor
text_entry: He shall, sir, an\'t please him. There\'s a letter for

speaker: First Sailor
text_entry: you, sir; it comes from the ambassador that was

speaker: First Sailor
text_entry: bound for England; if your name be Horatio, as I am

speaker: First Sailor
text_entry: let to know it is.

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: [Reads]  \'Horatio, when thou shalt have overlooked

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: this, give these fellows some means to the king:

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: they have letters for him. Ere we were two days old

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: at sea, a pirate of very warlike appointment gave us

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: chase. Finding ourselves too slow of sail, we put on

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: a compelled valour, and in the grapple I boarded

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: them: on the instant they got clear of our ship; so

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: I alone became their prisoner. They have dealt with

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: me like thieves of mercy: but they knew what they

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: did; I am to do a good turn for them. Let the king

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: have the letters I have sent; and repair thou to me

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: with as much speed as thou wouldst fly death. I

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: have words to speak in thine ear will make thee

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: dumb; yet are they much too light for the bore of

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: the matter. These good fellows will bring thee

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: where I am. Rosencrantz and Guildenstern hold their

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: course for England: of them I have much to tell

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: thee. Farewell.

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: \'He that thou knowest thine, HAMLET.\'

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Come, I will make you way for these your letters;

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: And do\'t the speedier, that you may direct me

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: To him from whom you brought them.

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: SCENE VII. Another room in the castle.

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Enter KING CLAUDIUS and LAERTES

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Now must your conscience my acquaintance seal,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And you must put me in your heart for friend,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Sith you have heard, and with a knowing ear,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: That he which hath your noble father slain

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Pursued my life.

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: It well appears: but tell me

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Why you proceeded not against these feats,

speaker: LAERTES
